page.title: 06Wawne, village housing.
page.content:
Long established village families live in the older houses, farm workers cottages, the lodge to Windham Manor, old farm-house lying within the village or the council owned estate, (built in the 50's).
The newer privately-owned housing estate is inhabited by 'newcomers', many with young families. These people work in Hull or Beverely and work in, mainly, either professional or business capacities. The newer houses are semi-detached chalet bungalows or houses, with a few larger detached ones here and there. Many were built on old church land or the site of Windham Manor (demolished in the 50's) and the new roads of Glebe Road, Church Rd and Windham Cresent reflect their origin in their names.
